Enums in vsip::impl

empty_layout_type

Enum to indicate that an Applied_layout or Rt_layout object will not be used and therefor should not be initialized when constructed.

rt_complex_type

Runtime complex format enum.

rt_pack_type

Runtime packing format enum.

Structs in vsip::impl

Any_type
Applied_layout

Applied_layout takes the layout policies encapsulated by a Layout and applys them to map multi-dimensional indices into memory offsets.

Cmplx_inter_fmt

Cmplx_inter_fmt indicates that complex data is stored as an array of type complex, which is assumed to be interleaved.

Cmplx_split_fmt

Cmplx_split_fmt indicates that complex data is stored in separate arrays of real and imaginary data.

Is_stride_unit_align
Is_stride_unit_align<Stride_unit_align<Align>>
Layout

Layout tuple groups a block's (compile-time) data layout information.

Rt_layout

Dimension,

Stride_unit

Stride_unit indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension is known to be unit-stride.

Stride_unit_align

Stride_unit_align indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension is known to be unit-stride and major dimensions are known to start on aligned boundaries.

Stride_unit_dense

Stride_unit_dense indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension is known to be unit-stride and major dimensions are known to be dense (contiguous).

Stride_unknown

Stride_unknown indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension stride is unknown.

Valid_complex_fmt

Validity check for complex format tags.

Valid_complex_fmt<Any_type>
Valid_complex_fmt<Cmplx_inter_fmt>
Valid_complex_fmt<Cmplx_split_fmt>
Valid_order

Validity check for dimension-ordering tuples.

Valid_order<Any_type>
Valid_order<tuple<Dim0,Dim1,Dim2>>
Valid_pack_type

Validity check for packing format tags.

Valid_pack_type<Any_type>
Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit>
Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit_align<Align>>
Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit_dense>
Valid_pack_type<Stride_unknown>
